answers.answer: Most people with hcv don't look sick or yellow. That usually happens in the acute stage, when the person first contracts hepatitis. Then the yellow and sick stuff subside are many people don't have symptoms for years, some do.  If a person who has hcv, and doesn't know it, gets sick from time to time it's usually written off to a cold or flu or something.  But even if a person does not have symptoms of hcv, the really cool part is that over the years hcv and all the nasty stuff it does slowly rots a person from the inside out.  When enough damage is done that when the real fun begins like spontaneous internal bleeding, loss of some brain functions, liver impairment and failure, liver cancer - stuff like that.   The keen part is that this kind of damage does not have to begin with hcv.  These kinds of things can happen and bring cirrhosis without hcv, if a person is just able to drink enough. 8 or 10 drinks 3 or 4 days a week should be about enough, over time.
